articles.description: Follow in-play clips, radio commentary and live text updates from the final day of the Ryder Cup at the Marco Simone Golf and Country Club, Rome.
articles.title: Ryder Cup: Europe start final day needing four more points for victory

articles.description: Watch and follow updates as Aston Villa host Manchester United in the first of six matches as the WSL season gets under way.
articles.title: WSL: Watch Aston Villa v Man Utd - first of six games on opening day

articles.description: Follow live text updates as Blackburn Rovers host Leicester City in the EFL Championship at Ewood Park.
articles.title: Championship: Blackburn Rovers v Leicester City

articles.description: Watch live coverage of the 2023 World Road Running Championships from Riga, Latvia.
articles.title: Watch: 2023 World Road Running Championships

articles.description: Darren England is replaced as the fourth official for Sunday's match between Nottingham Forest and Brentford after his VAR error during Liverpool's defeat at Tottenham.
articles.title: PGMOL replaces official England after Liverpool error

articles.description: Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez defends his WBO, WBC, WBA and IBF super-middleweight belts by beating Jermell Charlo in Las Vegas.
articles.title: Alvarez beats Charlo to keep undisputed crown

articles.description: A Dutch-top flight match between RKC Waalwijk and Ajax is abandoned after the home goalkeeper Etienne Vaessen is knocked unconscious.
articles.title: Dutch match abandoned after keeper knocked unconscious

articles.description: Scotland will require one of their "best ever performances" if they are to beat Ireland and reach the quarter-finals of the World Cup, says Gregor Townsend.
articles.title: Scotland need 'one of their best' against Ireland

articles.description: Tottenham and Liverpool prove they can both be contenders for this season's Premier League amid their pulsating encounter on Saturday.
articles.title: 'Spurs & Liverpool show they are ready to gatecrash title race'

articles.description: Match of the Day pundits Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Micah Richards discuss the controversial VAR decisions which ruled out Luis Diaz's goal and saw Curtis Jones sent off for Liverpool against Tottenham.
articles.title: Shearer & Richards on 'incomprehensible' VAR decisions
